results.title: Beach birds for camera
results.creator_credit: Merce Cunningham, Elliot Caplan and Cunningham Dance Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merce Cunningham Dance Company = Cunningham Dance Foundation”.
Beach birds for camera is a version for film of the dance “Beach birds”. It is in that sense a different piece from the stage production as the title suggests because of the medium used - film and all of its implied language. Merce Cunningham introduces the dance and extrapolates on his exploration of film as a medium for presentation and how the language of film affects the reading and possibilities of the production. Cunningham explores the language of film expressing this through change and use of the human body. Movement and time as with the use of the camera is an extension of the use of the human body. Cast is made from members from the Merce Cunningham Company with music by John Cage.

results.title: Beach
results.brief_description: Multi-layered interactive work using both still and moving images of Bells Beach, Point Addis and a beach cave. A beautifully constructed meditative piece accompanied by the sounds of nature.

results.title: Be well: physical fitness in the later years
results.brief_description: This film shows a variety of ways in which older people can stay physically active, or even start exercising regularly for the first time in their lives. Seniors who have incorporated such physical activities into their daily routines are living proof of the rewards.

results.title: Be quiet

results.title: Be prepared
results.brief_description: Discussion starter looking at the necessity for preparation in a group information session. Steve arrives late and is ill-prepared for his demonstration of a new slogan. His equipment fails, he is interrupted by workmen and he loses his audience. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Be it ever so humble
results.creator_credit: Ron Iddon, John Sparkes and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Big country”.
Shot in Queensland, this film examines the development in styles of houses in Australia, from the slab hut to the contemporary brick house. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: Be clean and healthy
results.creator_credit: Langton Gould-Marks and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Contrasts healthy children at play with a boy who is “out of everything” because of ill health. Shows simple rules for the care of the body, including the hair and teeth, how to dress comfortably, what to eat, and how to care for eating utensils.
